intro: Stenophragma toxophyllum, commonly known as the poisonwood plant, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its small, clustered leaves and yellowish flowers. The plant is known for its toxic properties, as its leaves contain compounds that can be harmful to livestock and humans. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its toxicity, it is generally avoided by grazing animals and requires careful handling.
